SecurityHubEnabled.^description: AWS Security Hub is not enabled. Security Hub provides a comprehensive view of your security alerts and security posture across your AWS accounts. It aggregates, organizes, and prioritizes security findings from multiple AWS security services and third-party tools.

AutoEnableControls.^description: Auto-enable controls is not configured in Security Hub. This feature automatically enables new controls when they are added to enabled standards, ensuring comprehensive security coverage.

SecurityStandards.^description: No security standards are enabled in Security Hub. Security standards provide a set of controls that evaluate your AWS resources for compliance with security best practices and industry standards.

AWSFoundationalStandard.^description: AWS Foundational Security Standard is not enabled. This standard includes controls that evaluate AWS resources against security best practices and is recommended for all AWS accounts.

CISStandard.^description: CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark is not enabled. This standard provides security configuration best practices for AWS and is widely recognized in the industry.

CriticalFindings.^description: Critical security findings have been identified in Security Hub. These findings represent severe security issues that should be addressed immediately.

HighFindings.^description: High severity security findings have been identified in Security Hub. These findings represent significant security issues that should be addressed promptly.
